event.name: REBEL_TURNCOAT
event.text: You receive a message from the sole passenger of a small Rebel shuttle. He looks frantic, breathing heavily and visibly sweating. "You're with the Federation, aren't you? Please listen. I must remand myself into your custody. I no longer wish to be associated with the Rebellion. You can take me prisoner if you want, I don't care. I won't be armed. Please decide quickly, I can't afford to wait."
"Thank heavens. I won't disappoint you." The Rebel quickly docks his shuttle to your bay. He's completely unarmed as he exits his ship. You have the shuttle scuttled for parts after he leaves it.

choice.text: Cautiously accept him on your ship, but have him thrown into the brig.

event.text: "Good enough for me." The Rebel quickly docks his shuttle to your bay. He leaves with his hands up in total surrender. Your crew surround him and escort him to the brig. He does not resist. You have the shuttle scuttled for parts after he leaves it.

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Have your drone escort him to the brig.

event.text: "Good enough for me." The Rebel quickly docks his shuttle to your bay. He leaves the shuttle with his hands up. He offers absolutely no resistance as your drone escorts him to the brig. You scuttle his shuttle for spare parts.

choice.text: This must be a trick. Keep your distance from the shuttle.

event.text: Once the Rebel realizes you're keeping your distance, he flees and does not look back.

event.name: MERCENARY_CHASING_REBEL_TURNCOAT
event.text: Not long after accepting the ex-Rebel onto your ship, a Syndicate ship jumps in. After a few moments, it sends you a message. "I won't take much of your time. There's a reward out for a certain Rebel. You hate Rebels, don't you? His bounty is quite lucrative. If you have any information about his whereabouts, we would be willing to give you a small piece of the pie."

choice.text: Turn the Rebel over to the Syndicate.

event.text: You tell the Syndicate about your Rebel prisoner. The Syndicate promptly teleports troops over to your ship. The Rebel screams and tries to flee, but they have him surrounded. After a short fight, they drag him off your ship, giving you a small amount of resources for your cooperation.

choice.text: (Positive Syndicate Reputation) Use your good standing with the Syndicate to make a trade.

event.text: Given your relationship with the Syndicate, you're able to work something out. The Rebel's face goes white as he realizes what a mistake he has made. The Mercenary smiles and orders his crew to hand you a healthy amount of scrap and a combat augment.

choice.text: (Angel Crew) Have your mercenary handle the trade.

event.text: Your crew's connections to the Syndicate give you a leg up on the bargaining table. The Rebel's face goes white as he realizes what a mistake he has made. The Mercenary smiles and orders his crew to hand you a healthy amount of scrap and an augment.
The ship waits for your response, but seems to lose interest in wasting their time with you, jumping off elsewhere.
You arm your ship and prepare for battle. "So you were involved with this traitor. This payout will be even better than we hoped!"

event.name: REBEL_TURNCOAT_AFTERMATH
event.text: The turncoat breathes a sigh of relief. "You are truly honorable, Renegade. I owe you my life. If you're okay with it, I would love to join your crew. If not, I'll get out of your hair once we reach Federation territory."

choice.text: Agree to drop him off in Federation territory instead.

event.text: The Ex-Rebel thanks you for your mercy and promises to spread news of your goodwill.

event.name: REBEL_COWARD
event.text: The Rebel at this beacon immediately begins to move away from you. "H-h-hello, Renegade...! I... uh... that is to say..." The Rebel gulps. "W-w-we can talk about this, right?"
"Y-y-yes, of course! Anyone w-w-who has a powerful thing like that d-d-deserves only the best! Please don't kill us!"

choice.text: (Highly Adv. Weapons) "Encourage" them to surrender generously.

event.text: "Y-y-yes, of course! Y-y-your weapons are surely very strong!! Please don't kill us!"
"Y-y-yes, of course! D-d-does this strike your fancy?"
"Hmm..." The Rebel stares thoughtfully at your weapons system. "Here's my offer. Is that enough?"
"That's it...?" The Rebel stares blankly at your weapons system. "You know what, take it or leave it, this is all I have to offer you."
"Oh thank goodness." The Rebel jumps away quickly, leaving you with the privacy you need to do something on your ship.

event.name: ATTACK_REBEL_COWARD
event.text: "AAAAAAIIIIIEEEEEE!" The Rebel screams unintelligibly over the comm as you attack them.

event.name: REBEL_BOOTCAMP
event.text: The Rebels have set up a bootcamp for advanced trainees. One of the trainees hails your ship. "Stay away, Renegade, or we'll have to show you what the Rebellion is made of!"

The bootcamp is abuzz with enthusiasm at the surprise appearance of Jerry, who proceeds to have a talk with them about your mission and goals. The trainees are universally supportive of Jerry's decision, and one of the soldiers even offers to join your cause. The trainees each scrounge for some resources as a gift for Jerry.

choice.text: (MFK Ace Crew) Make a case against the Rebellion.

event.text: The camp is in awe at the MFK that stands before them. He speaks of the folly of the Rebels, that the Federation is worth protecting. The MFK calls upon all of them to do their duty for the sake of humanity and help end this conflict. After hearing out your crewmember, one of the soldiers pledges to join your cause.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Make a case against the Rebellion.
(Human Crew) Make a case against the Rebellion.
Make a case against the Rebellion.
Keep away from the Rebel bootcamp.

event.text: You ignore the bootcamp to focus on other things.

Your crew tells the Rebels about the role that they have played in the instability of the human governments. If the Rebels win, the struggles are not over, but the Federation will have to change for the better anyway. The Rebels are swayed by your crew's persuasiveness. One of the humans decides to dedicate themself to your cause!

Your crew talks about the amount of death that the conflict between the Rebels and the Federation has caused - and how the Federation is still committed to the safety and well being of all humans. The Rebels are swayed by your crew's persuasiveness. A combat medic seems to agree with your goals and aligns with you!

Your crew talks of how the Rebels have damaged the infrastructure of human societies in their fight, and how life has gotten worse, not better since the start of the war. The Rebels are swayed by your crew's persuasiveness. While they seem hesitant about following you to the end, they give you a small tribute for sparing them and talking to them instead of engaging in violence.

Your crew tries to talk about the danger that the Rebels pose to all of the species of the galaxy. The Rebel trainees are incensed with your crew's attempt to sway them away from their cause! The trainees form a small mob and chase you back to the ship. Some careless upstarts break into your ship, thinking they can take you.

Your crew try to talk about the damage that the war is doing to the galaxy, but the officers in charge of the training approach with weapons drawn, chasing you back to the ship. Two well trained soldiers break into your ship, it looks like you'll have to fend off an attack!

The talk goes poorly. Every argument your crew tries to make is rudely interrupted by the audience. The trainees grab weapons and begin to fire them - as the crew makes their way back to the ship, one of the trainees lobs an incendiary bomb at your ship!

event.name: REBEL_CIRCUS
event.text: On the nearby planet there appears to be a large circus held by some suspicious looking civilians. It's not likely they'll care if you're a Federation ship.

The circus is much more underwhelming and run down than it appeared from above. Most of the attractions and rides look barely functional and definitely not safe. One exhibit however catches your eye, the freak show. On display are 5 aliens, likely slaves, a Slug, Rockman, Orchid, Zoltan, and Engi.

A bald civilian with an incredibly long beard welcomes you. "Step right up folks, and witness Sazalaraz the All-Seeing! He can see through walls, he can see the future, and he can see into your pockets! So keep a tight hand on your wallet, or next thing you know it might be missing!"
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Sazalaraz the All-Seeing? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."
A bald civilian with an incredibly long beard welcomes you. "Step right up folks, and witness Boulder the Boundless! He can lift anything, survive any collision, and feels no pain!"
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Boulder the Boundless? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."

A bald civilian with an incredibly long beard welcomes you. "Step right up folks, and witness Sapling the Giver of Joy! A quick inhale of the scent from his leaves and you'll be feeling higher than a kite! Feel free to come forth and have a whiff, but do note, we aren't liable for anything that happens to you."
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Sapling the Giver of Joy? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."

A bald civilian with an incredibly long beard welcomes you. "Step right up folks, and witness Namast the Energized! You won't ever be needing an outlet for charging your holopad when he's around! He can provide power to anything, because he's MADE of power!"
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Namast the Energized? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."

A bald civilian with an incredibly long beard welcomes you. "Step right up folks, and witness Q-32 the Cyclopean Engineer! He may only have one eye, but he's the master of tech! He can fix anything fast as lightning, debug any problem, and best of all he can't even feel emotions!"
The man looks at you strangely. "You want to BUY Q-32 the Cyclopean Engineer? Yeah sure, it'll be 20 bucks."
You have much better things to be doing.

event.name: REBELHOLD_REMOTE_COLONY
event.text: There doesn't seem to be any Rebel ships nearby, and the nearby planet only contains a single settlement. The planet has harsh climate conditions, with regular intense rainstorms - but the human colony below seems to be stable nonetheless.

choice.text: (Human Crew) Send your human to check out the colony.

event.text: Your crew heads down to the planet. The high winds make landing somewhat unpleasant, but fortunately the colony itself is relatively clear.

choice.text: You don't have any human crew, so visiting the colony might be dangerous.

event.text: You avoid the colony. It doesn't seem to have any places of interest anyway.

event.name: REMOTE_COLONY_MENU
event.text: Standing in view of the settlement, there are a number of places of interest, with people of many trades working here. You should have enough time to make a deal with one person.

The general store shopkeep smiles widely as your human approaches the counter. "Well hello there! Welcome to our fine establishment, out-of-towner. Not sure if we have anything that would interest the likes of a space traveler, but feel free to look around!"

The gunsmith looks very rugged, with many trophies of animals that must live on this planet. "Howdy there. I pride myself on my weapons, 'round these parts. Much better than your standard issue military grade firearms. If'n you think you can handle 'em."

choice.text: Buy personal weapons for your crew.

event.text: True to his word, the weapons seem to have a loving craftsmanship applied to them. Your crew carries the assortment of firearms back to the shuttle and returns to your ship.

The owner of the appliance store has her feet kicked up on the counter, reading a book. Once you enter, she glances your human's way, and nods in acknowledgement. The store is mostly full of things people on the planet would need, but there are a few drones for sale.
Your crewmember buys the repair drone and drags it back to the shuttle. It was relatively inexpensive for a repair drone, suggesting they may not have many opportunities to sell these on the planet.
Your crewmember buys the doctor drone and drags it back to the shuttle. It was relatively inexpensive for a medical drone, suggesting they may not have many opportunities to sell these on the planet.

choice.text: Have your crew return to the ship.

event.name: REMOTE_COLONY_CARPENTER
event.text: Your human is in the carpentry shop. The carpenter shoots them a quick glare, but doesn't say anything else. The shop isn't very well organized, but maybe you can find something if you look around.

choice.text: Poke around the shop for something to buy.

event.name: REMOTE_COLONY_CARPENTER_DISCOVERY
event.text: Your human wanders into a room that isn't lit. Curious, they open a nearby wardrobe, thinking it's part of the store. Inside, however, is a Rebel MFK uniform. Your crew feels something poking into their back, as well as the powering of an advanced Rebel carbine. You receive a hail in the meantime.
The carpenter is holding your crew at gunpoint. He growls at you. "You don't belong here, Fed."
"Your crew was trespassing. Saw something he shouldn't. I'm not afraid of violence, Fed. You turn, you take this idiot and get the hell off my property."

choice.text: Ask why he hasn't killed your crew.

event.text: The carpenter's glare sharpens. "Let's say I'm a kind and generous soul."

The carpenter sighs. "I tried. Hated the Feds. Hated how they would control us, and yet offer nothing in return. All I wanted was to be left alone. But no, I had to listen to some 'idealists'. Said we could set all humans free, said we'd protect those that can't protect themselves. Family encouraged me to join. But, what do I see? Soldiers, ignored, exploited, forgotten. We were all pawns. So I tried to rise higher. But, it didn't matter. Lotta good men would get depressed, wash out and be swept under. One day, I looked around me, and the only people I recognized were machiavellian wannabes who piggybacked their success on the lives of good soldiers. So, no. I am not a 'Rebel'."

choice.text: We want the fighting to stop too.

event.text: "Hmph. At least from a Fed, I can believe that. You're going after Wentworth, aren't you?" The carpenter lowers his weapon. "I've got a problem with him too. I'll follow you as far as the Flagship, then I'm living my own life. Got it?"

choice.text: We're going to win this war.

event.text: "Hmph, you really think so? The Federation is weak. If you want to see how it's done, I might be able to help." The carpenter lowers his weapon. "Just don't bother me when the mission doesn't require it."
"Good choice, Fed." The carpenter leads your crew member away from his shop, escorting him back to the shuttle. Doesn't look like you'll be welcome here anymore.
Without one more word, the carpenter pulls the trigger, ending your crewmember's life in an execution. Looks like you might not want to stick around here any longer.

removeCrew.text: Your crew, after stepping out of the Clone Bay, shakes their head. Maybe you could have spared your crew that execution.

textList.name: TEXT_CARPENTER_BENIGN
textList.text: Your human finds a field of chairs. They look to be both comfortable and sturdy. Great value, but maybe not what you need on a starship.
Your human finds a lovely dining table. Your human isn't an expert on wood, but the artisanal value is exquisite.
Your human finds a series of wooden figurines of animals of all sorts. Your crew seems to want one.
Your human finds a lovely cabinet, with a delightfully rustic feel. Should improve the comfiness of any dining room by 300%.
Your human wanders into the massive garage, which contains canoes, kayaks, and other small boats. Given the abundance of water on this world, they're likely to be useful.
Your human finds an array of empty barrels. Your crew takes entirely too long to realize they're empty because they're for sale.

event.name: REBELHOLD_WISTFUL_CITIZEN
event.text: You're receiving a call from a nearby planet, which is quite highly populated. This planet was one of the central points of conflict in the Federation-Mantis war, which might suggest why the Rebels have chosen to incorporate it into their space. The call is civilian, and is not marked as urgent. The signal quality is poor, suggesting there may be some damaged or outdated technology at play.
The voice is that of an elderly lady. "Hello, passing ship. You're one of those... reality jumpers, aren't you?"

"Oh, that's right. Sorry for the frivolous hail, but I've made a habit of checking the stars for unusual ships using whatever is left of my old, broken down cargo ship. Ever since the Rebels took over this sector, they've done their best to throttle any alien traffic in the region, so I'll take any rarity I can get. Back in the day, I would go gallivanting around the galaxy just like you. Not to other realities, we didn't have that back in my day. Why, I was just pleased to talk to my Zoltan friends back when I still could... See the galaxy, talk to different peoples... But with my health, I can't just go find them, to talk one last time."

"A friend of Zoltans? Well, a lot of us are a stubborn obstinate lot. Friendship between species sure made a lot more sense to me after I left the Duskbringers to join the Illesctrians... A life of fighting is no life, I tell you. Yes, you should be with your friends in your twilight years."
"A member of the Duskbringers who became a monk...? Sure sounds like you have quite the story, sonny."
"Story? You want to hear a story? Well, I never do this, but let me tell you about this time I was with a friend of mine named Obyn..."
You start to zone out as Anurak takes her on a journey of whatever his scatterbrained mind can recall of his life. At the end of it, you realize she has given you a gift for keeping her company.

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Set the lady's mind at ease.

event.text: Your monk talks to the lady, talking in spiritual language. The lady is able to keep up, satisfying your monk with a stimulating conversation. "Oho, I didn't expect a monk of all people to make their way here even when there wasn't a war... Thank you. Please, accept this gift." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

choice.text: (Devorak) Have Devorak talk to the lady.

event.text:
Devorak looks at you oddly, but relents. "...so you say you want to see a Zoltan one last time?" Her reply is quick. "Yes, I had quite a few Zoltan friends back in the day, but I haven't seen any in so long."
"One moment." Devorak uses his long range personal teleporter. The lady seems confused.
"What do you mean one- Aaaaah!" The lady screams "Did you just...?"
"Personal teleporter. Are you satisfied?"
The two talk for a short time, awkwardly, but when Devorak comes back, he has a weapon and some scrap, apparently a gift from Eleanor.

choice.text: (Duskbringer Crew) Have your Duskbringer talk to the lady.

event.text: Your Duskbringer is clearly uncomfortable talking to an old human lady, but warms up somewhat as the conversation goes on. "That was nice, I guess. You travel with some strange Zoltans, Renegade." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

choice.text: (Tintan and Rig) "Your name wouldn't happen to be Eleanor, would it?"

event.text:
"Yes? I'm sorry, sonny, I don't recall your voice."
"You don't know me. I am Rig. I think you might know a Zoltan envoy named Tintan. She had some business here many years ago. She's... here."
Eleanor seems excited. "Oh! Well, put her on!"
Rig sighs. "...This is as good as we can do." Eleanor seems confused. "I'm not going to get into it. It's stupid. She can't speak to anyone but me right now. But she wants me to tell you that she's glad to hear from you again."
"Tan... What are the odds? Well, you always were a big traveler. ...what exactly is the nature of your relationship?" Rig doesn't answer, instead turning to glare at you. You feel compelled to leave the room and give the three of them some space.
By the time the three of them are done talking, you find a generous amount of scrap and a weapon have been transported into space near you.

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew) Let her talk to another Zoltan.

event.text: Your Zoltan talks with the old lady for some time, as she reminisces with them about her past encounters with Zoltans, her friends. Unfortunately, they don't seem to know each other, but she appreciates it all the same. "That was nice. It's been so long, but now I feel just a bit younger again. Please, take this gift." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

choice.text: (Osmian Crew) Introduce her to your Osmian.

event.text: You introduce an Osmian crewmember to her. A sense of awe fills her voice. "The ancestors of the Zoltans still exist?? That's... that's incredible! Who are you? Why have you come here?" She shakes her head. "Well, you think you've seen it all, and then something comes along and changes everything. Please, accept a gift. You've brought me comfort in my late years." A weapon and some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

choice.text: We're doing our best to change things.

event.text: "Well, I guess I'm rooting for you then. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

"Don't get smart with me, child! I'm not going to report you to the Rebels. I just want to talk a little bit. I swear that this war has made a liar out of everyone... Back when it was the Mantises - you know, I was never fond of them of course, especially after what they did to this planet - but at least that war was between undivided populaces! Now everyone fights among themselves... I tell you, we got along much better back then, dagnabbit. Is that kind of unity even possible these days?"

choice.text: (Turzil) What we stand for is more important than what we are.

event.text:
"I can identify [with] your struggles. My -own- government wishes to purge what I am for my dissent. But as I fought alongside my -Federation- colleagues, be they Engi, Zoltan, -Orchid- or Human, I have discovered a [purpose] greater than I had ever known. Adversity was the -crucible- that forged the individual you see before you, and [the] friends it had found along the way."
"Ohoho, you are right. Despite your mechanical body, you make that sound almost magical..." she trails off. "Oh, I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." A weapon and some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

choice.text: (Separatist Crew) Disunity isn't a bad thing.

event.text: Your Separatist goes on a short ramble about the Engi Separatist movement, and about how despite being originally from a hivemind, individuality and found family can persevere. "Ohoho, I have always been impressed by the Separatists, but I'd never connected it to the concept of the Rebellion... Yes, maybe it is a good thing that people are free to choose their own path, whether it be for more freedom or not. Oh, I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

"My good lady, I've been around since the Federation-Mantis War. The combatative Free Mantis soldiers and the Hive may seem pugilistic - but that is not the whole story! Why, I myself belong to the original movement of the Free Mantis, the scientists, engineers, architects, thinkers... We left the Hive for something better. Had we stayed loyal to the Hive, the wrongs of Queen Leikonpliiinakra would still stain our appendages! No - things are better now. At least, for those of us in the Free Mantis. We can better ourselves without bringing harm to others."
"Ohoho, you know how to give a doddering old fool like me some hope, don't you? Yes... maybe unity hasn't gone after all. If well-mannered Mantises are capable of unifying with humans after a war like that..." She trails off. "Oh, I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." A weapon and some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

choice.text: (Free Mantis) Disunity isn't a bad thing.

event.text: Your Free Mantis begins to ramble about the schism, and how ultimately it's better to be fighting who they want, and to not fight the people of the Federation. It's more than a little incoherent, but the sentiment is not lost. "Ohoho, this rambunctious little guy is a Federation-loving Mantis? Never would have thought of such a thing back in the day, I tell you. Maybe we haven't lost unity after all, it's just that we're friends with people we agree with instead of people who look like us... Oh, I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

"Hah! If the first Dread Pirate Tuco could hear you, he'd spit! The Theocracy Elders have always used our peaceful disagreements as an excuse for violence against us. I do not care for the Rebellion... but I will tell you this. A people fighting amongst themselves is not always a bad thing. I, Tuco, will stand arm-in-arm with any aboard my ship, and that is true unity! And if we have to fight the universe for our right to do so, then we'll gladly do so!"
"Ohoho, you are right. I have been cooped up planet-side for too long... Everything is so much more clear up there in the stars. If my health were better I'd..." she trails off. "Oh, I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." A weapon and some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

choice.text: (Outcast Crew) Disunity isn't a bad thing.

event.text:
Your outcast tells the old woman a story of the Theocracy cracking down on dissent, and about how the outcasts banded together. Unity can't be forced, your outcast says.
"You're a passionate sort, aren't you? I think you have a good point... I don't know if it really applies to the conflict between the Rebels and the Federation though. Oh, I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

"I cannot speak for the human Rebellion, but for the Lost Suns, we did not go to war because there was no unity. We went because false unity is imposed upon us! It's impossible to oppose an organized force with centuries of legacy and wealth behind it unless you have comrades that you can depend upon. And I will tell you this... that I am working with the Federation's Renegade despite the Federation and Lost Sun's disagreements is a sign that unity is not dead."
"Ohoho, you know what you're talking about much better than I do. It's been a long time since someone corrected me so thoughtfully. If I could go back into space, maybe I could gain some of my perspective back..." she trails off. "Oh, I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." A weapon and some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

choice.text: (Lost Sun Crew) Disunity isn't a bad thing.

event.text: Your Commando speaks of the civil war amongst the Theocracy and the Lost Suns - how the Lost Suns feel more purpose and unity in arms alongside each other than they ever had when in the Theocracy. "You're a passionate sort, aren't you? I think you have a good point... I don't know if it really applies to the conflict between the Rebels and the Federation though. Oh, I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.

"Well, there's only so much we can do. I've wasted enough of your time. I'm sure you've got somewhere to be. Take this and enjoy yourselves." Some scrap is teleported into space near your ship - which you grab.
Eventually, the call cancels. Nothing else happens.

event.name: REBELHOLD_AUTO_LOREKEEPER
event.text: An Auto-ship has been stationed here, but it does not turn hostile when it notices you. "Greetings tourist. I am the Lorekeeper, an automated ship tasked with keeping a full history of the glorious Rebellion and all its brilliant victories and rare defeats. A reward awaits those who take the time to listen to our 100% accurate historical retelling."

"The Rebellion first began in 2757, founded by the now Admiral Vance Wentworth, a brilliant and handsome man who was dissatisfied with the way the Federation operated after 30 years of working under their command." As you start listening, you realise this is going to take a while.

"It is common knowledge that the human race is superior to all other aliens. Therefore, it is the Rebellion's divine right to overthrow the Federation and establish a glorious, human only galactic government. Other aliens will be allowed to exist on the outskirts so long as they avoid communicating with humans."

"The most known battle in Rebel history was the Battle of Node 17, often referred to as the Last Stand. The outcome of Node 17 has never been repeated except for Universe 0, the origins of multiverse travelers. Though the Federation was successful in defeating the Rebels, their celebration would not last for long after the Rebels discovered the mysterious Multiverse technology."

"We owe our collective thanks to the brave heroes who have provided the other Rebels across the realities the chance to bring a better future to their galaxy. This concludes the retelling. Accept this complementary augment and supplies for taking the time to educate yourself."
Almost the second you mute the Auto-ship, its weapons activate and it attacks!
Almost the second you mute the Auto-ship, its weapons activate and it attacks!
The ship does not try to contact you again.

event.name: AUTO_CIVILIAN
event.text: You come across a Rebel automated scout ship pursuing a civilian ship, weapons engaged.
You power up your weapons and engage the automated ship.
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range.

event.name: REBEL_REFUEL_STATION
event.text: You detect a Rebel ship on an attack approach to a small refuelling outpost. Their weapons are charged, but they're not firing yet.
The Rebel responds to your threat, "I don't know who you are, but no one defies the Rebel Fleet!" They move in to engage.
The Rebel ship fires some warning shots but eventually powers down their weapons. The outpost seems to have given them what they demanded.

event.name: AUTO_REFUEL_STATION
event.text: You detect an automated Rebel scout attacking a small refuelling outpost.
Detecting the higher threat, the automated ship moves in to engage your ship.
You steer clear of the conflict. The outpost receives a beating but the ship stops its attack before it's destroyed.

event.name: AUTO_DEFENSE_MAP
event.text: You find an automated sensor station at this beacon, protected by a singular Auto-ship patroling around it.

choice.text: Attack the automated ship to get to the sensor station.

event.text: You prepare to fight.
You have no need to stir up trouble with the Rebels.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Use your sensors to attempt to access the data.
(Teleporter) Beam directly onto the station to try to avoid detection.

event.text: Once on board, your crew is able to access and download the long-range scanner's archived information. Your map has been updated.

choice.text: (Central Teleport) Beam directly onto the station to try to avoid detection.

event.text: Once on board, your crew is able to access and download the long-range scanner's archived information. Your map has been updated.
Your improved Sensors are able to remotely access and download the public radar station's local map data.
The automated ship must be remotely connected to the station; as soon as you attempt to log on, the ship activates and charges you.

event.name: AUTO_DEFENSE_ITEM
event.text: An advanced Rebel automated ship remains stationed near a small Rebel space-station. Sensors indicate it's a storage vessel for military goods.

choice.text: Attack the automated ship to get to the storage cache.

event.text: You prepare to fight.
You have no need to stir up trouble with the Rebels.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Attempt to cloak and access the cache.

event.text: The ship patrols wide around the area, successfully approaching the station while avoiding detection.
Before you can get close enough to scan the station, the automated ship detects you and moves in to attack!
The station was either abandoned or stripped clean. It seems to have lain unused for quite some time. You find nothing useful.
The station was apparently designed to outfit Rebel ships with Drone Systems. You find a functioning Schematic.
The station is a storage site for military grade weapons. You find one that can be easily attached to the ship.
The station is a storage site for various resources. You salvage everything possible.

event.name: AUTO_DEFENSE_RADAR
event.text: A Rebel automated ship sits dormant near a Rebel forward radar station.
The ship powers up and targets you.

choice.text: Keep your distance and wait for the FTL to charge.

event.text: You have no need to stir up trouble with the Rebels.

choice.text: (Combat Drone) Send a drone to distract the automated ship.

event.text: Your combat drone attacks the automated ship and then retreats, luring it away. You quickly move up to the radar station to access it.
Your combat drone repeatedly fires at the automated ship. It can't break through its shields, but is at least enough of a distraction to allow you to access the radar station.
Before your drone has a chance to attack, the automated ship activates and shoots it down. It then detects your ship and moves in on your position.

event.name: DEFENSE_RADAR_ACCESS_MV
event.text: The station in question appears to be capable of relaying information to the Rebel Fleet. You could attempt to hack it to give the Rebels false information.

choice.text: Attempt to manually hack into the station.
Don't risk it. Leave the station.
(Hacking) Use a drone to hack into the station. [-1|]

event.text: You successfully hack into their system and transmit false information about your location. That should hold off the fleet for at least a little while. You also are able to download data about the surrounding beacons.
You successfully hack into their system and transmit false information about your location. That should hold off the fleet for at least a little while.
The firewalls prove too difficult to bypass. As you are about to disconnect, you stumble across unprotected information about the surrounding beacons. Your map is updated.
You are unable to penetrate the computer's defenses. You give up and return to the ship.
As you attempt to hack in, you set off a hidden alarm system. It seems that now the Rebels must surely be aware of your position! You hasten back to the ship to jump away.

event.name: BROKEN_REBEL_DRONE
event.text: You find a Rebel automated scout floating near this beacon. Despite its pristine condition, it appears to be de-activated.

choice.text: Attempt to download the ship's data stores.
Don't risk activating it, and just strip the ship for any useful scrap.

event.text: You are able to pull all of the ship's data about this sector. Your map has been updated.
You accidentally reactivate the ship's AI. Its weapons immediately go online; prepare for a fight!
Your improved Sensors indicate that it's safe to hack into the drone. You upload its map data to your navigation system and strip the ship of useful materials.
Your improved Sensors indicate the ship is on standby, ready to activate at a moment's notice. Will you still attempt to access the ship's data?
You leave the ship alone and prepare to jump.

event.name: REBEL_DEFECTOR
event.text: A Rebel ship is patrolling this beacon, and immediately turns to engage. As your crew scramble to battle readiness, sensors detect a short-range teleporter signal. An intruder is on board!
A flushed and panicky Rebel soldier has teleported aboard. The Rebel, who appears unarmed, repeatedly declares his peaceful intentions. It seems the Rebel life has lost its charm.

choice.text: Accept his proposal, and prepare to fight the Rebel ship.
Reject his offer. You can never trust these Rebels.
(Slug Crew) Have your crewmember check their intentions.
(Telepathic Shell) Have your crewmember check their intentions.
Terminate the intruder immediately. You can never trust these Rebels.

event.text: Your advanced security system easily removes the intruder, but the Rebel ship still needs to be dealt with.

Your crewmember checks their intentions for a few seconds, but is unable to find anything suggesting that they would be hostile. You let the former Rebel join your crew, and prepare to fight the Rebel ship off.
It takes almost no time for your crewmember to determine that the Rebel in question is aiming to trick you. Though they're easily taken care off, you still have the other Rebels to deal with.
Your fearless crew easily overcome the intruder, but the Rebel ship still needs to be dealt with.
Attempting to deal with attacks from inside and out is never easy!
He offers to lead you to a secret cache of scrap nearby if you let him join your crew.

choice.text: Reluctantly accept his proposal and fight the Rebel ship.
Reject him outright and execute him on the spot.

event.text: The dishonorable Rebel has deceived you. He damages your engines and steals your flight data before teleporting away. The fleet will be able to track you with ease. If they can't kill you now that is!
Your new crew-member smiles, then reveals a small remote trigger in the palm of his hand. Explosions rocket around the ship as more intruders teleport aboard!
Relieved and light-headed, your new crewmember gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crewmember gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crewmember gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
The Rebel makes to take his assigned station, then suddenly turns and eviscerates the nearest crew-member. Red Alert!

removeCrew.text: The eviscerated crewmember's clone launches out of the Clone Bay, eager to seek revenge.

event.text: The dishonorable Rebel has deceived you. He damages your ship and steals ship information before teleporting away. The fleet will be able to track you with ease. If they can't kill you now, that is!
Your new crew-member smiles, then reveals a small remote trigger in the palm of his hand. Explosions rocket around the ship as more intruders teleport aboard!
Relieved and light-headed, your new crewmember gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crewmember gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
Relieved and light-headed, your new crewmember gets to work as the Rebel ship attacks.
The Rebel makes to take his assigned station, then suddenly turns and eviscerates the nearest crew-member. Red Alert!

removeCrew.text: The eviscerated crewmember's clone launches out of the Clone Bay, eager to seek revenge.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Advertised location of a scrap stash given by a Rebel defector.

event.text: Arriving at the specified coordinates you find a sizable stash of useful materials.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Advertised location of a scrap stash given by a Rebel defector.

event.text: You arrive at the location of the hoard, but discover that it was not quite as large as advertised.

event.name: REBELHOLD_SUPERFISH
event.text: You brace for impact as soon as you recognize the formidable hull of an MFK Ace. However, two things are wrong here. The first, their logo is not the usual eagle, but a very poorly drawn fish. The second, the ship isn't attacking. The second question is answered when they hail you. The captain is leaning back in his chair, feet on the dashboard, and chewing on a sandwich. "You're lucky you caught us on our lunch break. You don't tell anyone about this, and we won't either."

choice.text: Your logo looks like it was drawn by a toddler.

event.text: "Hey! This was the original design, before the idiots in command decided to stick with the eagle instead!" Enraged, the ship attacks.

"You really like it? This was the original design, before the idiots in command decided to stick with the eagle instead! Wait a minute- you're Jerry! How's it going, man? I haven't seen you since you were our best man at my wedding!" You aren't sure how these two hold a history together, but the Ace is so elated to see Jerry that he offers to work on your ship.
The Rebel chuckles and turns off the screen. You carry on your way.

event.name: DEFEATED_SUPERFISH
event.text: The strange MFK ship has been defeated. You scrap the remains.

event.name: REBELHOLD_ELITE_CHOICE
event.text: You jump in your seat when you see the Rebel Elite at this beacon. However, it seems they have not noticed you in return.
You prepare for combat with the elite.
You don't feel like dying today. You steer clear of the elite Rebel.

event.name: REBELHOLD_ARCHIVE
event.text: A large Rebel station is orbiting a nearby planet. It seems to be an archive of data, and is very poorly armed. It is however protected by an MFK Ace. There must be very important data in that archive.

choice.text: Attack the patrol ship to get to the Archive.

event.text: This will be one hell of a fight. You check to make sure everything is in order and ready for battle.
Whatever data that Archive holds, fighting an MFK Ace isn't worth it.

event.name: REBELHOLD_ARCHIVE_WIN
event.text: Seeing how you managed to take out one of the strongest classes of Rebel ships ever produced, the station isn't eager to fight back. They willingly surrender their facilities to you.

There's a lot more in the archive than you had even thought. You take only what you think would be useful, a map of the sector, and a beacon for merchants. You also take the liberty of deleting all data they have on the whereabouts of your ship.

event.name: REBELHOLD_SPEECH
event.text: On the nearby planet, there is a massive Rebel city that spans most of the planet's surface. A lot of Rebel and civilian ships are heading towards it, and you can see a stunning light show all the way from your ship. Something important must be going on.

You avoid all of the Rebel patrols and find a landing pad whose staff doesn't ask any questions about who you are so long as you turn off your weapons when you leave. You leave your Federation badges in the ship and follow all the traffic to a giant stadium.

In the center of the stage is an important looking Rebel politician, surrounded by 3 big screens projecting Rebel propaganda. You can just barely make out what he's saying over all the cheering from the crowd. "Friends and friends to be, we have all gathered here to celebrate the might of the Rebellion! We have received news that the new Rebel Flagship gifted to us by the Multiverse travelers has reached the Federation Capitol! The Federation's days are numbered, and soon the Rebellion shall rise and take its place!"

choice.text: Send one of your crew to assassinate the politician.

event.text: You wish you had brought your ship, but if you go back now it may be too late. You use your handheld scanner to find a good vantage point and send one of your crew to prepare.

choice.text: With you out here on your own, there is little to do.
(Elite Crew) Send your elite to assassinate the politician.

event.text: Your crew swiftly sneaks into the backstage, climbs onto the roof, and draws their rifle. It only takes one shot, and the lifeless body of the politician flops into the crowd, spraying the crowd with blood. Your crew hurries back, taking out two of the guards that try to follow on their way. The Fleet will be too busy dealing with all the chaos you've caused here, and likely won't be concerned with following you for a while.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Your Slug thinks they can hack into the screens.

event.text: Your Slug snickers as they hack into the screens' mainframe. The display goes black for a minute, confusing everyone in the crowd. A few seconds after, they switch to Federation propaganda. After a massively negative reception from the crowd and doubled efforts from the Rebels to counter the attack, your Slug gets tired and switches the screens over to a very explicit program. He breaks into laughter, and you hurry back into the ship before the Rebels can follow. When you return to the ship, you find a Soldier already waiting for you. Before you can raise your weapons, they hold up their hand to stop you. "No need to worry, I am on your side. I was sent to work undercover, but I haven't been able to contact the Federation for days. I was afraid I'd have to steal a Rebel shuttle to get back, but luckily I think I've found my way out with you guys instead."
The politician salutes to the crowd, and they begin to chant "Glory to the Rebellion!" You hurry back to the ship and leave.
Investigating a metropolis so deep inside enemy lines is suicide. Getting out of this sector is more important for your journey.

A suspicious amount of time passes without response from your crew. You're about to call them when a group of security guards come out onto the stage. Your heart drops when you see the bruised body of your crew member with them. They whisper something to the politician, who then says, "It appears this scum has attempted to take my life with a simple hand held laser! The Federation cannot see that a little gun will not stop the Rebellion!" The guards drop your crew onto the floor, and the politician swiftly draws an old Earth revolver and shoots them three times in the head. You quickly hurry out of the stadium before they can catch any more of you.

removeCrew.text: Luckily, by the time you've returned to the ship your crew is already waiting in the Clone Bay room, pouting about their failure and public execution.

event.text: A long time goes by, and you begin to fear the worse. Suddenly, you hear shouts and even screaming and your crew member comes charging back through the crowd, followed by a set of guards. You run back to the ship, the guards following in pursuit.

A few minutes after you sent your crew away, a loud bang echoes across the stadium. The politician's eyes go wide in surprise and they flop off the stage into the crowd. The entire place erupts into total chaos, civilians running in every direction. Your crew member comes rushing back, and you head back to the ship as fast as possible. With all the chaos you've caused, the Rebels are going to need to spend a lot of time on damage control. You doubt the Fleet will be concerned with following you for a while.

textList.name: DISTRESS_REBEL_HOSTILE
textList.text: The distress signal at this beacon is coming from a Rebel ship. "Warning to all ships! We barely escaped from a silver Duskbringer cruiser fully decked for war!" They stop abruptly upon detecting your ship. "Oh come on! Another one?!" Full of exasperation, they attack your ship.

The distress signal at this beacon is coming from a Rebel ship. "Evacuate this region! We spotted a horrifying Mantis Renegade armed with a full array of bombs!" They stop abruptly upon detecting your ship. "We might be able to take this one. Battle stations!"

The distress signal at this beacon is coming from a Rebel ship. "General alert: We've encountered a pitch black, nearly indestructible Renegade! Recommend-" They stop abruptly upon detecting your ship. "Are we being invaded by Renegades or something?"

The distress signal at this beacon is coming from a Rebel ship. "I don't mean to alarm anybody but there's a Kestrel class ship with an absolutely absurd rate of fire. We barely escaped with-" They stop abruptly upon detecting your ship. "I'm so tired of Renegades." Reluctantly, they attack you.

The distress signal at this beacon is coming from a Rebel ship. "Stay clear! Some Renegades have jury-rigged a Federation cruiser to lob gigantic mines! We were a hair's breath from blowing up!" They stop abruptly upon detecting your ship. "How are there so many of you guys?"

The distress signal at this beacon is coming from a Rebel ship. "Be warned! An amber-colored Renegade has been spotted lighting Rebels on fire and freestyle rapping insults about our demise." They stop abruptly upon detecting your ship. "...At least this one's not flooding our comms with obnoxious garbage."

event.name: DISTRESS_REBEL_DISTRACT_CHECKPOINT
event.text: A Union ship waits here. "Oh thank heavens, we thought you were a Rebel at first. We've had to evade them several times, but fortunately they've bought all our excuses so far... We need your help, there is a nearby planet that is being guarded by a Rebel checkpoint. We have family there that we were trying to smuggle back to Union controlled space - would you please distract the checkpoint for us?"

choice.text: Agree and go attract the attention of the checkpoint.

event.text: The moment you approach, the Rebels accost you. "An enemy ship? You have 10 seconds to explain yourself before we destroy you!"

"By my stars, is that Jerome Wentworth? Hey, everyone, come look at who it is!" The entire checkpoint starts to come by the screen to see the famed nephew. The Rebels are all too happy to converse with him for as long as he wishes, giving the Union ship ample time to extract the other humans. One of the Rebels even tries to garner favor with Jerry by giving a present.

Your MFK imposes onto the checkpoint, making all the Rebels stand at attention. Your MFK takes their time, ensuring that no Rebel is near the sensors. Once the extraction is complete, you send your MFK the signal, and he gives the checkpoint a passing grade before departing.

choice.text: (Technician Crew) Inform them you are here to provide a system upgrade.

event.text: Your technician goes aboard the station. The Rebels are all impressed by the presence of a Wentworth Estate employee and allow them aboard. Your Technician powers the station off and pretends to do an upgrade, adding unnecessary but flashy features to their station, describing them as "cutting edge". The Rebels don't suspect a thing.
You decide that getting rid of the checkpoint entirely is the simpler solution.
"We'll find another way, then." The ship goes back into hiding.

event.name: REBEL_UNION_DISTRACT_CHECKPOINT_AFTERMATH
event.text: "Thank you for the distraction. We were able to get our families. We should be able to make it back to our home territory on our own." After compensating you, they jump away.

event.name: DISTRESS_REBEL_DEPOT_PROBLEM
event.text: The distress call comes from a Rebel munitions depot. "Renegade, this depot is not for you! Warp away, or we will call for help!"

choice.text: Aren't you already calling for help?

event.text: "You... make a good point." The Rebel sighs. "Our refrigeration units on this outpost broke down. All of our perishable food will spoil in less than a day unless we get it fixed. We sent our guard away to find an engineer who can fix or replace it, but they've completely dropped off the map. As it is, we're barely hanging on here. I have no desire to starve. Perhaps if you can help us, we can come to some kind of arrangement?"

They seem relieved to see a fellow human. The engineer diagnoses the problem, and indeed they have no parts to fix it. Fortunately, this component exists on your own ship as a redundancy. The refrigeration unit is fixed.

They seem wary at the prospect of an alien fixing their issue. The Engi diagnoses the problem, and indeed they have no parts to fix it. Fortunately, this component exists on your own ship as a redundancy. The refrigeration unit is fixed.

They seem relieved to see a drone with repair capabilities. It identifies the problem, and indeed they have no parts to fix it. Fortunately, this component exists on your own ship as a redundancy. The refrigeration unit is fixed.

As you dock with the depot, the Rebels desperately send a team inside to attack you. However, this will leave their stockpile entirely vulnerable, allowing your crew free reign to take from the depot.
You also find a leftover missile weapon in the depot.
It would be nice to plunder the depot intact, but it's better to avoid letting the Rebels use it. Maybe this will slow them down some. You take what you can find from the rubble.
The Rebels seem annoyed. It's likely they'll find a way to inform the fleet of your location.
You decide not to bother with the depot.

event.name: DISTRESS_REBEL_DEPOT_PROBLEM_SOLVED
event.text: "I guess you'll be expecting payment now, hm? Given your powerful armament, I guess we have no choice. We'll supply you with some missiles. Don't come back here, Renegade."

event.name: DISTRESS_REBELHOLD_POW
event.text: An encrypted Federation distress signal comes from an escape pod on a nearby planet. Decoding it, you get the following message: "Escaped POW. Evac requested immediately." In orbit, scanning for the prisoner is an MFK. For the moment, they seem distracted by their current duty of combing the planet.
As they become aware of you, they immediately switch to targeting you. "Well, well, well. Looks like we've found some more potential prisoners. We'll find the escaped one later."

choice.text: Use the distraction to slip away.

event.text: The MFK's sensors are occupied - this is an opportunity that doesn't come around often. You retreat before they notice you. Unfortunately, you don't have time to do anything as you prepare your escape.

event.name: REBEL_SELITE_POW
event.text: The MFK elite was formidable, but you managed to bring them down. You scrap their ship, getting quite the hefty bounty.

Your upgraded sensors pick up the location of the prisoner very quickly. You send down your crew to the escaped prisoner's hiding spot. Once your crew approaches them, they recognize you as Federation. Your crew welcomes the escaped prisoner aboard. "I knew it was a long shot, but Renegades have been known to make it this deep into Rebel space in the past. Please let me join your crew."

Your Lifeform Scanner picks up the location of the prisoner very quickly. You send down your crew to the escaped prisoner's hiding spot. Once your crew approaches them, they recognize you as Federation. Your crew welcomes the escaped prisoner aboard. "I knew it was a long shot, but Renegades have been known to make it this deep into Rebel space in the past. Please let me join your crew."

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Try to sense the prisoner.

event.text: Your Slug leads a search party looking for the prisoner. Using their telepathic abilities, they're easily able to figure out the prisoner's location. Once your crew approaches them, they recognize you as Federation. Your crew welcomes the rescued prisoner aboard. "I knew it was a long shot, but Renegades have been known to make it this deep into Rebel space in the past. Please let me join your crew."

choice.text: (Telepathic Shell) Try to sense the prisoner.

event.text: Your Shell leads a search party looking for the prisoner. Using their telepathic abilities, they're easily able to figure out the prisoner's location. Once your crew approaches them, they recognize you as Federation. Your crew welcomes the rescued prisoner aboard. "I knew it was a long shot, but Renegades have been known to make it this deep into Rebel space in the past. Please let me join your crew."

choice.text: Take some time to send down a search party.

event.text: The prisoner was very skillful at hiding - it's quite the undertaking to go looking for them. Eventually, they realize that the search party sent to rescue them is from the Federation, and they reveal their presence. Once onboard, they sigh with relief. "I knew it was a long shot, but Renegades have been known to make it this deep into Rebel space in the past. Please let me join your crew."

event.name: REBEL_CONSTRUCTION_CREW
event.text: As you enter the beacon, you notice the planetary system contains a number of construction ships gathered around a Rebel ship. As they are civilians, you might be able to tap into their feeds if you get closer.
The moment you get close enough, the Rebel ship stops broadcasting and attacks you on sight!

choice.text: (Upg. Mind Control) Wait until the end of the meeting and compel one of the construction ships to fill you in.

event.text: You corner one of the construction ships. Your Mind Control system hums to life, and the captain of the ship responds as if to a friend. "Oh, we're just headed off to enter the final construction phase of the newest Rebel space-dock in this sector. Let me give you the coordinates, if you want to stop by!"

choice.text: Leave before the Rebels notice you.
Attack the Rebel before you leave.

event.text: The Rebel seems so far unaware that you were here and attacks you on sight!

choice.text: (Mind Control) Wait until the end of the meeting and try to compel one of the construction ships to fill you in.

event.text: You corner one of the construction ships. Your Mind Control system hums to life - however, the captain struggles against the system. "Augh! We... are... helping... ttttttoooooo... build... a... spaaaaace dock." Before you can get much more out of the captain, however, the Rebel ship seems to have noticed your activities!

choice.text: (Mind Control Weapon) Wait until the end of the meeting and compel one of the construction ships to fill you in.

event.text: You corner one of the construction ships. Your Mind Control weapon locks on and bursts with its hypnotic energies. The captain of the ship responds as if to a friend. "Oh, we're just headed off to enter the final construction phase of the newest Rebel space-dock in this sector. Let me give you the coordinates, if you want to stop by!"

choice.text: Leave before the Rebels notice you.
Attack the Rebel before you leave.

event.text: The Rebel seems so far unaware that you were here and attacks you on sight!

You get closer to tap into the broadcast. As you listen, you learn that a new Rebel space-dock is almost finished! These ships are going to finalize the construction process. During the speech you're able to glean the directions to the constructed spaceport. As the meeting ends, the construction ships approach the beacon and start jumping away while the Rebel stays at its post.

choice.text: Leave before the Rebels notice you.
Attack the Rebel before you leave.

event.text: You decloak behind the Rebel and ambush them. They are caught off guard, but quickly respond to your aggression!

choice.text: (Cloaking) Try to spy on the meeting.

event.text: You get closer to tap into the broadcast. As you listen, you learn that a new Rebel space-dock is almost finished! These ships are going to finalize the construction process. Unfortunately, you don't manage to find out much before your cloak wears off! The Rebel immediately attacks once they notice you.

choice.text: Keep your distance to avoid being spotted.

event.text: You keep your distance, so much so, that you aren't able to monitor their movements. Even so, you afford yourself the space to work on something else.

event.name: QUEST_REBEL_INCOMPLETE_DOCK

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Rebel space-dock is being constructed here.

event.text: With the coordinates you obtained, it's relatively easy to find the space-dock. It's most of the way done, but a few good shots in some vulnerable areas could bring it down. However, as you draw near, an Elite Rebel blocks your path. "So you want to hurt our infrastructure, don't you? I won't let you go any further!"

event.name: REBEL_DOCK_GUARD_DEFEATED
event.text: The Rebels scream as you swiftly end their lives. The elite ship was well equipped to defend their structure, but clearly not well enough.
The construction ships begin to flee. This is your chance to take it down.

choice.text: (Adv. Weapons) All out assault with your weapons system.

event.text: You pummel the dock's structure with your weapons system. The partially completed structure buckles and starts to come apart. Eventually, you reduce large areas of the dock to slag. While they still might be able to salvage this, you have certainly set them back.

choice.text: (Heavy Weapon) Hit the most sensitive spots with your heavy weapons.

event.text: You carefully line up your shots, and knock down the sensitive areas of the dock. Your precise hard hitting blows have exactly the effect you intended: the dock collapses in on itself under its own weight. With one final well placed shot, the mess explodes outwards. They're not making anything out of this anytime soon, but you most certainly are.

choice.text: Rig some explosives at critical areas to greet the Rebels when they come back.

event.text: You set up some explosives hidden in crucial areas, and arm them such that when the Rebels come back to this place and inspect your handiwork, they will be caught in the crossfire. This does mean you won't be able to salvage the wreckage of the dock, but you scrounge whatever materials they left lying around before you leave.
You have enough problems to worry about already. You carry on without any further interference.

event.name: REBEL_COLONY_PRISONBREAK
event.text: A small damaged colony lies in the distance. It appears to have once been under Rebel control, but the colonists revolted and broke free. You receive a hail from the colony, marked as urgent.

"A Federation ship, here in the Rebel stronghold? Here, before us in our time of most dire need? This truly is our lucky day... As you can see, we have recently broken free from our Rebel oppressor. But it was not without loss. The Rebels took some of us as prisoners and are transporting them back to one of their high security containment facilities. We don't have the manpower to save them, but maybe you can? All you need to do is intercept the jailer ship. We placed a tracking beacon on it before it got away, so finding it won't be difficult."

choice.text: Agree to track down the jailer.

event.text: "Oh thank you. I knew we could count on the Federation!"

choice.text: We cannot risk our primary mission.

event.text: While it's a relief to see opposition against the Rebel cause even in their territory, you do not have time to stop by and assist with whatever requests these colonists would ask from you.

event.name: QUEST_REBEL_COLONY_PRISONBREAK_JAILER

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of a Rebel Jailer detaining colonists loyal to the Federation.

event.text: You've found the Jailer. They're already charging their FTL drive. You'll have to take them down before they can escape, and hopefully not destroy the ship in the process.

event.name: REBEL_COLONY_PRISONBREAK_JAILER_SURRENDER
event.text: The damaged ship hails you. "Y-you were sent by those colonists weren't you? Fine, you can have the prisoners back. Just let us live."

choice.text: Accept the surrender and free the slaves.

event.text: The colonists are grateful for your help. As you do not have time to return to the colony, you drop them off at the nearest station, where they will be able to find a ship to help them. You are paid heavily for your assistance.

choice.text: Screw the mission, let's kill these Rebel bastards.

event.name: DESTROYED_REBEL_PRISONBREAK
event.text: You've destroyed the jailer, and no doubt all of the colonists onboard. The colony will never give you a reward now, so you'll have to be content with the scrap from the wreckage.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_REBEL_PRISONBREAK
event.text: Without any of the Rebel crew onboard, you're able to scrap the exterior of the ship before checking on the prisoners.

The colonists are grateful for your help. As you do not have time to return to the colony, you drop them off at the nearest station, where they will be able to find a ship to help them. You are paid heavily for your assistance.

event.name: REBEL_COLONY_PRISONBREAK_GOTAWAY
event.text: The Jailer jumps away, and will no doubt arrive at the containment facility before you can catch it. That doesn't mean all hope is lost. You can still track the ship's location, and maybe defeat it before the prisoners are dropped off.

event.name: QUEST_REBEL_COLONY_PRISONBREAK_FINAL

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of a Rebel Jailer detaining colonists loyal to the Federation.

event.text: You've tracked down the jailer once again, but they've already transferred crew to a much stronger MFK Ace ship. It won't be an easy fight, and there will be no surrender. If you want to free the colonists, you'll have to kill their crew.
The Rebels aren't about to back down from a fight. The containment facility activates an ASB satellite to fire upon you.

choice.text: This is far too dangerous. We should go.

event.name: REBEL_COLONY_PRISONBREAK_FINAL_DEADCREW
event.text: Without any of the Rebel crew onboard, you're able to scrap the exterior of the ship before checking on the prisoners.

It is very dangerous to transport all of the colonists back to the colony now. With the MFK Ace still intact, most agree to steal the ship and pilot back. However, one colonist decides to stay with you. You are paid for your efforts as well.

event.name: REBEL_COLONY_PRISONBREAK_FINAL_DESTROYED
event.text: You've destroyed the MFK Ace, and likely all of the colonists onboard. You'll have to be content with the salvage the ship provides, and leave quickly before the ASB can destroy you.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL
textList.text: A Rebel appears on the screen, and unfolds a long sheet of paper. He dons a pair of spectacles, and begins to read; "A poem, for you. Ahem; Die."
Your ship is hailed. "We've found you at last. Prepare to die!"
A small Rebel ship is docked at a small station. You try to lay low but it spots you. Power up the weapons!
A Rebel ship has been patrolling this region. As soon as you arrive it begins its assault.
A Rebel ship hails you: "Federation scum! We've waited a long time for this!"
You receive a transmission: "Sorry sir, this is nothing personal but we're under orders." The Rebel ship's weapons go hot.
By the time you notice the Rebel ship behind the beacon, it's too late to avoid a fight.
A Rebel ship hails. "We did not fight a war to let a single Federation ship shatter our dreams of a better galaxy!" He locks weapons.
A Rebel ship approaches cautiously. "Personally," says the captain, "I'd have stuck with the Federation. But I'm a soldier, sir, and I'm no use without a war to fight. Raise your shields!"
You're hailed by a Rebel ship: "When the rebellion is complete you'll see the safer world we provide. Well, you won't, but you get the point." They arm weapons.
You receive a hail from a Rebel fighter: "I'll have you know I graduated top of my class in the-" you cut off the Rebel ship and prepare to fight.
Your arrival coincides almost exactly with that of a Rebel ship. It's hard to know who is more surprised, but there is no option but to fight.
"GLORY TO THE REBELLION!" A Rebel ship speeds past, firing its entire salvo at you. Defensive positions!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_PULSAR
textList.text: A Rebel captain appears on the screen. "I thought we had been doomed to backwater assignments. This is my chance to get back in Command's good graces! Charge the weapons!"
A small Rebel research station overlooks a pulsating star. Before you can react a Rebel ship spots you and moves in to attack.
You arrive at an infrequently used beacon close to a pulsar. Before long a Rebel ship happens to jump nearby. Looks like you'll have to fight.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_REBEL_ASTEROID
event.text: Rebel ships often try their best to avoid hazardous beacons, but it appears a forward scout of the fleet has gotten lost in this asteroid beacon. Upon seeing you, they turn to attack!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_REBEL_SPY
event.text: You stumble across a forward scout of the Rebel fleet.

textList.name: BOARDERS_REBEL_SHIP
textList.text: You receive a message from a nearby Rebel station, "You have a lot of guts passing through our space, I'll give you that." He turns giving an order, "Kill their crew, I want that ship intact."

Your sensors warn of an incoming Rebel ship at the same time as you hear the telltale signs of a teleporter. You hear someone taunt from within the ship, "Ready to die? I sure am ready to get a promotion!"
Incoming message, "Hello Captain," says a Rebel in an officer's garb. "How very generous of you to turn yourself in. Prepare to be boarded. Come quietly and we may be lenient."
You receive a message on a low-band channel. "You're surrounded, just like the last of your Federation friends. Just die already." The enemy has teleported onto your ship!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AUTO_ION
event.text: A peculiar Auto-ship with blue lights reveals itself in this asteroid field. "This automated ship is a prototype Ion Deterrence Drone. Thank you for participating in this equipment test."

event.name: AUTO_ION_WIN
event.text: "T-thank you ffff-or participa- in this test- test- test- test-" the Auto-ship is silenced by an explosion. In the wreckage you find a still functional, special Ion weapon.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_REBELHOLD_STATION
event.text: A Rebel checkpoint identifies you as Federation. "You'll regret coming here, scum!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_REBEL_ELITE
event.text: Rebel Elites are usually only seen in the Rebel Fleet, but it seems one of their ships is protecting this beacon. A fight is inevitable.

destroyed.text: The MFK Ace has been destroyed. You hastily scrap the remains then check on the transport.

deadCrew.text: The MFK Ace has been defeated. You hastily scrap the remains then check on the transport.

event.name: JERRY_QUEST
event.text: An MFK Ace ship is conversing with a transport, surprisingly not on an encrypted frequency. However, it seems obvious why. They're talking of nothing important, and you consider just passing them by, when suddenly the conversation shifts. The MFK, addressing the transport's captain, asks, "So, you're heading to the Protectorate, right?" The transport captain nods, briefly taking a cigarette out of his mouth to let out a simple "Yessiree".

The Ace leans in closer, eager to pry more details from the captain. "Really now? You gotta tell me what goes on in there. Years ago, Vance brought this scruffy little blonde kid to training, said he was his nephew or somethin'. He was some 3 years our junior, but he kicked every Ace's ass in combat practice, then waddled off to go draw a horse with some crayons on the wall. Then one day, Vance came back and yanked the kid. Don't know what happened to him, but I heard after director Black retired, Vance put her in the Protectorate to watch over his nephew."

The other Rebel captain nods, but the look on his face suggests he's growing impatient. "Yeah, yeah. Okay, cool exposition. But why are you telling me this? Aren't you supposed to be off, I dunno, killing Feds? I got a job to do buddy, I can't sit here on my ass all day. Get to the point." The Ace shrugs, displeased about his tone. "Look, what I'm asking for is some... you know, inside info? Surely, you got some if you go to and from that place all day."

The captain shakes his head. "First off, anything I could tell you, I can't. Closed lips on all that jazz. Second off, I don't know shit either. All I'll say is this - rumors are right about Cyra running the place, and she keeps a tight ship. I've never been past the wall. Well, a glimpse. But it's nothin' special. Now, get out of my way." The MFK Ace is indignant that even he has been refused information, but he only growls and moves his ship out of the transport's way. If you want to pursue this, now's your chance.
You take this moment to reveal yourself, and immediately the transport begins to charge its FTL drive. The MFK Ace flings itself to face you, weapons charging. You've gotta be quick about this!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: If you do not defeat the MFK Ace in this amount of time, the transport will escape!

event.text: The Rebel soldiers stare at you, utterly confused. You wait a little longer in desperate hope but, as you should have expected, the Rebels have no intent of giving you the information. The transport immediately begins to charge its FTL drive. The MFK Ace flings itself to face you, weapons charging. You've gotta be quick about this!

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: If you do not defeat the MFK Ace in this amount of time, the transport will escape!

choice.text: Weird deja vu, but we've heard this all before.

event.text: This conversation isn't worth your time. You distance yourself from the Rebels.

event.name: JERRY_QUEST_FAIL
event.text: It seems you're out of time. In the distance, the transport escapes, and once the Ace realizes this they show an uncharacteristic display of cowardice and run as well!

event.name: JERRY_QUEST_SUCCESS
event.text: The transport makes every attempt to flee, and you follow them in hot pursuit. Unfortunately, they manage to slip away - but not all is lost. During the struggle you managed to get a lock on their FTL signatures, and now you can follow them during hyperspeed!

event.name: REBELHOLD_FLAGSHIP_SURPRISE
event.text: This is it... The Rebel Flagship. If you are able to destroy this monstrosity, the Federation fleet will have a chance of surviving. Only, it already looks to be significantly damaged, is transmitting a surrender signal, and this isn't even Node 17. What exactly is going on?

choice.text: Contact them. Something seems amiss here.

event.text: The crew onboard the Flagship initially seem terrified of your presence, though take on a slightly more aggressive demeanor to try and disguise it. "Shit, looks like we've been found out here. Whaddya want, you Renegade crazies? Scrap? A second surrender from us? Some sort of "secret ending" to celebrate over?"

The Flagship's captain continues. "Yeah, that's right. Back in whatever reality we were tasked with taking over, the Renegade who U0 tasked with taking us out somehow convinced the Rebel forces there to surrender. Impressive stuff, considering what you lot are known for. And good for us too, because we get a nice honorable discharge instead of getting murdered three times over. Then, on our way back to U1, we ran into some sort of bizarre anomaly and got flung here. Anyways, you never told us what you wanted, so spit it out."
"Well, that's easy to provide. Here you go. And make sure none of your Federation buddies in this reality know about us being here, got it?"

choice.text: Whatever that fancy weapon on your ship is.

event.text: "Oh, uh, that? U1 installed it on our ship before we even set off. They said something about it being a "new top secret weapon" or something of that nature. Unfortunately, we can't just hand it over. U1 command would kill us otherwise. So, how about a compromise?"
You accept the new offer. They then jump away, but not before asking you to keep their presence here a secret.

choice.text: Attack them to get the weapon.

event.text: "Ugh, should've known not to act reasonable around Renegades. Well, if you lot want a piece of this Flagship, we're gonna make sure you get the full package!"

choice.text: A little extra time in this sector.

event.text: "Well, that is something we can do, and odds are we're probably not going to get caught out on it, so I think we could help out by misleading the fleet. Just make sure nobody in the Federation knows we were here, got it?"

choice.text: Escape before they can attack you.

event.text: You give the Flagship a wide berth, in case it suddenly turns aggressive. Fortunately, it makes no attempt to initiate combat, leaving you with some time on your hands to prepare for the real deal.

destroyed.text: You defeated the Flagship at this beacon. Hopefully this success bodes well for the rest of your mission.

event.text: Fortunately, the strange weapon you were interested in survived the fight. You carefully remove it from the wreckage of their ship.

deadCrew.text: You've cleared out the Flagship's crew. Though you're normally used to the Flagship having an AI take control under such circumstances, it seems it's either not present or not functional at this time, allowing you to salvage in peace.

event.text: Fortunately, the strange weapon you were interested in survived the fight. You carefully remove it from the wreckage of their ship.

event.name: FLAGSHIP_CONSTRUCTION
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to find yourself in a huge Rebel shipyard, scaffolding and construction drones filling the entire surrounding area! The entire system looks devoted to ship construction, the nearby planets and moons ruthlessly mined to harvest resources for ships of immense size...

You move closer to the planet's surface, noticing a giant hangar. The ships inside must be enormous in size. Around the outskirts are a few scattered Rebel ships patrolling. You could probably pick any one of them to fight.
You enter the hangar and are left in awe at the sight inside. A massive Multiverse Flagship, still under construction, rests inside. Dismantling this thing could save a whole other reality!

This could very well be just as important as your primary mission. You move in to attack the Flagship, as the crew of construction workers onboard quickly evacuate and are replaced by well trained human soldiers.

choice.text: Get the hell out of here.

event.text: You leave the hangar as quickly as possible and fly away from the shipyard until you're sure you're out of danger.

choice.text: Fight one of the normal Rebel ships.

event.text: You move in to intercept one of the regular Rebel ships.

choice.text: Fight one of the Elite Rebel ships.

event.text: You move in to intercept one of the Elite Rebel ships.

choice.text: Fight one of the MFK Ace Rebel ships.

event.text: You move in to intercept one of the MFK Rebel ships.
You feel the mission is the highest priority and it's too risky to stay in such a dangerous location.

event.name: FLAGSHIP_CONSTRUCTION_WIN
event.text: You know with an infinite amount of potential realities there are thousands more Flagships out there, but without this one at least one more reality has been saved. It's a major victory, and there's countless scrap for you to collect, and even the blueprints of a Rebel cruiser left unprotected! Cautious of reinforcements arriving, you take as much as you can and leave. The Fleet will likely be too distracted dealing with this loss to follow you.

event.name: CONSTRUCTION_NORMAL_WIN
event.text: It's not much of a challenge nor will it have any impact on the Rebels, but this ship destroyed still means one less crew of Rebels to terrorize the galaxy. You scrap the remains quickly before reinforcements come.

event.name: CONSTRUCTION_ELITE_WIN
event.text: It won't have much of an impact on the Rebels, but it's one less elite ship for them to throw at you. You scrap the remains quickly before reinforcements come.

event.name: CONSTRUCTION_SELITE_WIN
event.text: The Rebels cannot easily replace their fallen MFK Aces, and every one that you destroy is bound to put a big dent in their reserves. You quickly scrap the remains before reinforcements come, and while you're doing it you find a still functional weapon in the wreckage.

deadCrew.text: You detect no more lifesigns on the incomplete Flagship. You'd expect a ship of that size to have more security measures, but perhaps their computer systems aren't complete yet.
